intro: Digitalis purpurea var. albarracinensis, commonly known as the Albarracin foxglove, is a rare and striking variant of the foxglove genus. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Spain, specifically the Sierra de Albarracín. This plant is characterized by its tall, spire-like inflorescence bearing tubular, violet to white flowers. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a unique addition to alpine gardens.
